text.p: Chemical and fertiliser producer Incitec Ltd said on Wednesday its immediate outlook was positive.

The company earlier reported a 50 percent jump in full year net profit to A$60.08 million, which reflected strong results achieved by the businesses aligned to agriculture and strong mining sector demand for nitrogen chemicals.
Icitec said the overall result for the 1997 year ending September 30 would depend on demand, weather, international pricing and competitive activity.
However, the company warned the year would be negatively affected by a six week shutdown of the Gibson Island factory for upgrading.
Incitec raised its total annual dividend to 40 cents full franked from 27 cents for the previous year.
Incitec is about 70 percent owned by ICI Australia Ltd.
Incitec shares closed 10 cents higher at A$6.60 on turnover of 162,281 shares.
